name: SkilLit Readers x Champaca : Emerging Readers Programme
description: When children step into a story, they don’t just meet characters, they meet ideas that shape how they think. This November, Champaca is partnering with SkilLit Readers, a story-led skills lab, to launch the Emerging Readers Programme for children aged 6–9. This programme transforms books into springboards for reflection, expression, and connection, nurturing confidence, critical thinking, and creativity. In this first edition, children will explore the theme of inclusivity, engaging with books that open conversations about belonging, empathy, and courage. Our November–December batch will explore this theme through two wonderful books: Left-Out Paru  by Bijal Vachharajani Manya Learns to Roar  by Shruthi Rao Here are the details: Dates:  Every Saturday from 1 November to 13 December 2025 ( except 6 December) Time:  11:00 AM – 12:30 PM Venue:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar Age Group:  6–9 years Fee  : INR 7000 Since seating is limited,  sign up here! About the Event: The Emerging Readers Programme is a six-session journey designed to help children discover the joy of reading while building essential life skills. Each session includes a read-aloud followed by playful, experiential activities through art, roleplay, music, movement, and more. These activities encourage children to reflect on themes, characters, and stories in fresh ways. Each programme wraps up with a lively showcase, where children get to share what they’ve discovered in their own unique and creative ways. Parents are invited to join one of the sessions, and kids will also get to meet and chat with a children’s author! About the Facilitators: Poorvaja Prakash – Co-Founder, SkilLit Readers  Poorvaja has over 12 years of experience in International Development, Social Impact, Facilitation, and Research in organisations such as Teach For All, Peepul, and Global School Leaders, among others. She is an alumna of Columbia University (Teachers College), London School of Economics (LSE), and Stella Maris College. She has also published in a peer-reviewed journal and other platforms and is the host of a sports-related podcast. Srilakshmi R – Co-Founder, SkilLit Readers Srilakshmi has 12+ years of experience as an English and Social Science teacher in IB and ICSE schools such as Chaman Bhartiya School, Oberoi International School (JVLR Mumbai), The Gateway School of Mumbai, and Head Start Educational Academy, Bangalore. She is an alumna of Azim Premji University and Christ University. Srilakshmi is an IB Certified Educator. She has a special interest in children’s literature from across the world.

name: Silent Journeys: Book Launch with Benyamin and Karthik Venkatesh
description: What of the many travels undertaken through history by men and women—through war and peace—that have remained unrecorded, forgotten, and silent? This October, we invite you to the launch of  Benyamin’s  latest novel,  Silent Journeys , a sparkling chronicle of Kerala’s pioneering women. Benyamin’s  Silent Journeys  brings one such story to life, exploring the remarkable lives of women whose travels shaped communities and inspired generations. In  Silent Journeys , we follow Mariamma, a young nurse from Manthalir, Kerala, whose remarkable journey in the 1940s was uncovered decades later by her inquisitive great-grandson. Her story is emblematic of the courage, resilience, and determination of countless women whose adventures have gone unheard. Part quest, part epistolary narrative, the novel brings these unsung protagonists to life through the power of fiction.  Here are the event Details:   Date:  12 October 2025, Sunday   Time:  6:00 PM   Venue:  Champaca Bookstore, Vasanth Nagar Since the seating is limited,  sign up here! About the Book:   Silent Journeys  follows Mariamma’s extraordinary path from Kerala to the farthest reaches of the world in the 1940s. A story of adventure, hardship, resilience, and love,  Silent Journeys  illuminates the lives of these silent pioneers and brings their legacy into the light. Through her experiences, the novel honors the brave, unaccompanied women whose travels have remained unrecorded. About the Speakers:  Benyamin  is an acclaimed Malayalam author, whose novel  Aadu Jeevitham  ( Goat Days ) won the Kerala Sahitya Akademi Award in 2009 and was shortlisted for the DSC Prize in South Asian Literature in 2013. In 2018, he won the inaugural JCB Prize for Literature for  Mullapoo Niramulla Pakalukal  ( Jasmine Days ). Benyamin’s work is celebrated for its compelling storytelling, exploration of human resilience, and deep engagement with social and cultural histories. Karthik Venkatesh  is a literary curator and cultural commentator who has hosted numerous book launches, discussions, and literary festivals across India. With a deep passion for storytelling, Karthik brings authors and readers together to explore the layers of narrative, history, and imagination in contemporary literature.

name: Between Worlds: Book Discussion moderated by Gautam Bhatia with Suchitra Sukumar, Priyamvadha Shivaji, and Srividya Tadepalli
description: Join us on 19th October, for a discussion on  Between Worlds , a groundbreaking anthology of Indian science fiction and fantasy. The evening will feature a panel discussion with the editor and contributing authors, exploring the vibrant and diverse voices shaping the future of SFF writing in India. Here are the details: Date:  19 October 2025 Time:  6:00 PM Venue:  Champaca Bookstore, Vasanth Nagar Since seats are limited, we recommend you  sign up here! About the Book: Between Worlds  is the introductory Indian speculative fiction anthology of new SFF writing. Eschewing the model of commissioning stories to collect a “best of,” this anthology seeks to ask, with curiosity: what’s out there? Thoughtfully curated and shepherded by  Gautam Bhatia , it showcases the vibrant and diverse voices shaping Indian speculative fiction today. Blending the surreal with the urgent, these original stories traverse memory and identity, rebellion and love, from queer inter-species romance to interplanetary sleuthing. Alongside the fantastical, the collection confronts the very real—climate catastrophe, AI, surveillance and capitalism—offering bold, unexpected visions from the liminal spaces of Indian SF. About the Speakers: Gautam Bhatia  is a writer, reviewer and editor based in New Delhi, India. He is the author of  The Sentence , and the science fiction duology,  The Wall  and  The Horizon , and the coordinating editor of the science fiction magazine  Strange Horizons . In his other life, he is a constitutional lawyer and public commentator on civil and constitutional rights in India. Suchitra Sukumar  is a self-taught writer based in Bangalore, India. She has published short fiction in the  Bombay Literary Magazine ,  Mean Pepper Vine  and  Tasavvurnama , and is currently working on a fantasy novel. She juggles her time between writing and a full-time job. Priyamvadha Shivaji  grew up on Chennai's beaches, dreaming about strange worlds beyond the horizon. She spends her time working as a human rights lawyer and policy researcher, and devouring fantasy stories along with endless bowls of Maggi and cups of cold coffee. Srividya Tadepalli  is a writer based in Chennai. She won the Deodar Prize in 2023 for her story,  Funeral for a Demon . Prashanth Srivatsa  is the author of The Spice Gate, a standalone fantasy novel published by HarperCollins. The Spice Gate was a finalist for the Locus Award and a UK Sunday Times Bestseller. He lives in Bangalore with his partner and two cats.
